docs.title: getDefaultSettings
docs.summary:
This method provides a list of default configuration values for a project.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

docs.title: Keyword Contains One Of Filter
docs.summary:
Keywords must contain AT LEAST ONE of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords that include any term from the array will be returned. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phras...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_contain_one_of","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"05fdf7d269008"},"$defs":{"keyword_contain_one_of":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains One Of Filter","description":"Keywords must contain AT LEAST ONE of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords that include any term from the array will be returned. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phrases containing at least one of the specified terms in their exact form (but not "backlinks" or "ranking" when searching for "backlink" or "rank").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **at least one** word is present, regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"371c51352bb3f"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_one_of_schema"}}}}

docs.title: intents not contain filter
docs.summary:
Exclude keywords that contain any of the specified search intents. This filter helps you remove unwanted intent categories from your keyword results.

**Available values:**
- `informational` - The user is looking for information or answers to a qu...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/intents_not_contain","x-stoplight":{"id":"0822f9da2dc4f"},"$defs":{"intents_not_contain":{"type":"array","title":"intents not contain filter","description":"Exclude keywords that contain any of the specified search intents. This filter helps you remove unwanted intent categories from your keyword results.

**Available values:**
- `informational` - The user is looking for information or answers to a question. Example: *how does bitcoin work*, *symptoms of flu*. These queries aim to learn something, not to buy or act.
- `navigational` - The user wants to go to a specific website or brand. Example: *facebook login*, *netflix homepage*. The goal is to reach a particular site, not to discover new options.
- `commercial` - The user is researching products or services before making a purchase. Example: *best budget smartphones*, *iPhone 14 vs Samsung S22*. They intend to buy, but are still comparing and gathering opinions.
- `transactional` - The user is ready to complete an action, often a purchase. Example: *buy nike air max*, *order pizza online*. This is the "I'm ready to act now" intent — usually monetizable.","items":{"type":"string","enum":["informational","navigational","commercial","transactional"],"x-stoplight":{"id":"109dec8dbf537"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"intents_not_contain_filter"}}}}

docs.title: Serpstat SERP Crawling API
docs.summary:
Get real-time search engine results data with the SERP Scraping API. Create tasks to parse the SERP for any keyword, location, and device for the most up-to-date insights.

### Current version: 2

https://serpstat.com/rt/api/v2 — Endpoint URL, thr...
docs.data:
{"id":"0b54hq7qrsbab","name":"Serpstat SERP Crawling API","description":"Get real-time search engine results data with the SERP Scraping API. Create tasks to parse the SERP for any keyword, location, and device for the most up-to-date insights.

### Current version: 2

https://serpstat.com/rt/api/v2 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits 

- This API has separate billing and credits type for this API are not included in any available subscription plan. [Contacts sales](https://data.serpstat.com/serp-api-scraper/) for details.

- The cost varies from $0.0013 to $0.00065 per one keyword depending on the volume of credits required.

- The minimum budget for the service is $300 ( ~ 230,000 SERPs)
- Unlimited number of requests per day and month.

- Perform analysis regardless of the availability of a pricing plan or available credits.

- Credits for SERP Crawling don't expire at the end of the month, you can use them when it is convenient for you.

- All keywords accepted to task are billed after task submission.

- Charged credits are not refundable.

### AI Overview
Google AI Overview results are currently available within standard SERP Crawling requests at no additional cost. 
This allows you to access AI-generated summaries and reference sources as part of your regular SERP data. However, **starting August 1, 2025, AI Overview data will become a separate optional parameter with additional pricing**. After this date, you will need to specifically enable AI Overview in your API requests and account for the additional costs in your usage billing.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

docs.title: getUrlCompetitors
docs.summary: The `SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlCompetitors` method returns the list of URL competitors to the queried URL. The data set is similar to the [Competitors report](https://serpstat.com/urls/competitors/?query=&se=g_us&search_type=url) in the URL analy...
docs.data:
{"id":"0euusensv6kpf","iid":"post-#SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlCompetitors","method":"post","path":"/#SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlCompetitors","summary":"getUrlCompetitors","description":"The `SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlCompetitors` method returns the list of URL competitors to the queried URL. The data set is similar to the [Competitors report](https://serpstat.com/urls/competitors/?query=&se=g_us&search_type=url) in the URL analysis.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: the number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request (items in `data` section of respone ). 

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

> You can get no more than 60 000 results per a query.

Use case:
1. Get a list of competitors for a specific domain and analyze their strategies to improve your website's visibility in search engines.
2. Use method `SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlCompetitors` with your website domain.
3. Receive and save the response with a list of competitors and relevant data.
4. Analyze the data to improve your SEO docs.title: SERP Scraper API
docs.summary: SERP Scraper API offers the following key benefits for SEO specialists and business owners:
docs.data:
## SERP Scraper API

SERP Scraper API offers the following key benefits for SEO specialists and business owners:

- Deep understanding of competitors' SERP positions
- Identification of industry leaders' effective SEO strategies
- Research of high-ranking pages' meta tags
- Analysis of URL structure and internal linking
- Tracking search position dynamics
- SERP changes monitoring

SERP Scraper becomes an indispensable tool for making data-driven decisions in SEO and improving website visibility in search engines.

> **AI Overview**: Google AI Overview results are currently available within standard Desktop and Mobile SERP Scraper requests at no additional cost. This allows you to access AI-generated summaries and reference sources as part of your regular SERP data. However, **starting August 1, 2025, AI Overview data will become a separate optional parameter with additional pricing**. After this date, you will need to specifically enable AI Overview in your API requests and account for the additional costs in your usage billing.


### Credits and pricing

- This API has separate billing and credits type for this API are not included in any available subscription plan. [Contacts sales](https://data.serpstat.com/serp-api-scraper/) for details.

- The cost varies from $0.0013 to $0.00065 per one keyword depending on the volume of credits required.

- The minimum budget for the service is $300 ( ~ 230,000 SERPs)
- Unlimited number of requests per day and month.

- Perform analysis regardless of the availability of a pricing plan or available credits.

- Credits for SERP Scraper don't expire at the end of the month, you can use them when it is convenient for you.

- All keywords accepted to task are billed after task submission.

- Charged credits are not refundable.

- "Pay as you go" and recurring billing options are not available for this API



## API Methods and Flow
Description for all available [methods of Serpstat SERP Scraper Api](/docs/serpstat-public-api/0b54hq7qrsbab-serpstat-serp-crawling-api)

At the core of SERP Scraper service lies an elegant three-step process flow that ensures deep SERP analysis:

### 1. Initialize
Through the API interface, you submit a request to analyze a set of keywords considering the specifics of your chosen search region. This ensures obtaining maximally relevant data for your target geolocation.

Use method [`addTask`](/docs/serpstat-public-api/fd78zl20ap9w1-add-task) to submit your keyword list to parsing. This method is suitable for tasks with one or a small number of keywords.


Use method [`addKeywordList`](/docs/serpstat-public-api/9elengxj24hwb-add-keyword-list) to add up to 10,000 keywords per top parsing task.

Both methods returns `task_id`, save it for the future, to get results.

If some of your keywords doesn't meet the common validation criteria you would receive non empty array `blocked_keywords` in response: 

```json
{
  "id": "123",
  "result": {
    "task_id": "5492895",
    "blocked_keywords": [
      "*****"
    ]
  }
}
```
<!-- theme: danger -->
> Blocked keywords are not charged and can't be parsed by our API. They won't be included in the parsing task.



These references help you to choose the right ones id's for:
 - [language](/docs/serpstat-public-api/wuoshjguna09o-languages)
 - [search region](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LUDtm-L1qWMVpmWuN-nvDyYFfQtfiXUh5LIHE8sjs0k/edit?pli=1&gid=75443986#gid=75443986)
 - [country code](/docs/serpstat-public-api/oerp7nc8ivqp7-countries)

### 2. Wait till it's done
Usually, top parsing takes up to 2-3 minutes depending to task size and service load.

Use method [`getTaskResult`](/docs/serpstat-public-api/50bwxkycuia8p-get-task-result) to get results. If task is not complete you will receive response like that

```json
{
  "id": "123",
  "result": {
    "progress": "0%",
    "message": "Not all keywords have been tracked"
  }
}
```

The system provides real-time task status updates, ensuring complete transparency of the data collection process.
Use method 

### 3. Get results!
Use method [`getTaskResult`](/docs/serpstat-public-api/50bwxkycuia8p-get-task-result) to get results again after little while.
Upon completion of the analysis, you receive structured search results data for your keywords list. Each result contains detailed information about positions, meta-data, and other key SEO parameters found in SERP like that:

```json
{
  "id": "123",
  "result": {
    "task_meta": {
      "se_id": "1",
      "country_id": "23",
      "region_id": "21176",
      "device_type_id": "1"
    },
    "tops": [
      {
        "keyword_id": "707207631",
        "keyword": "eat jelephones on breakfast",
        "keyword_data": {
          "top": [
            {
              "url": "https://www.reddit.com/r/ketorecipes/comments/2y1c6r/jalapeno_poppersfor_breakfast/",
              "domain": "reddit.com",
              "subdomain": "www.reddit.com",
              "title": "Jalapeno Poppers...for Breakfast! : r/ketorecipes",
              "title_length": 49,
              "snippet": "Jalapeno Popper Egg Cups. Yields 12 Egg Cups. Macros Per Egg Cup 216 Calories, 19.3g Fats, 0.9g Net Carbs, and 9.6g Protein. Perhaps the epitome of volume eating, the Balkan ...62 postsSep 23, 2024TIFU by eating too many jalapenos. - Reddit136 postsJun 3, 2013Are these Jalapeño peppers safe to eat? : r/PepperLovers28 postsDec 7, 2022I always throw out jalapeños when they get wrinkles. I ...68 postsNov 2, 2023More results from www.reddit.com Missing: jelephones  Show results with: jelephones",
              "snippet_length": 497,
              "breadcrumbs": "20+ comments  ·  9 years ago",
              "spec_elements": [
                {
                  "type": "snip_breadcrumbs",
                  "content": "20+ comments  ·  9 years ago",
                  "href": null,
                  "anchor": null,
                  "sort_number": 0
                }
              ],
              "types": [
                "snip_breadcrumbs"
              ],
              "position": 1
            }
          ],
          "ads": {
            "1": [],
            "2": [],
            "3": []
          },
          "results": 51000,
          "right_spell": "ear headphones on breakfast",
          "types": [
            "pic",
            "also_asks",
            "related_search"
          ],
          "top_features_content": [
            {
              "PeopleAlsoAsk": {
                "PeopleAlsoAsk": {
                  "people_also_ask_block": [],
                  "people_also_ask_questions": [
                    "Can you eat Knafeh for breakfast?",
                    "Is it okay to eat a lot of jalapenos?",
                    "What are the benefits of eating jalapenos?",
                    "Is it okay to eat jalapeno as a snack?"
                  ]
                }
              }
            }
          ]
        },
        "target_fields": "[]"
      }
    ]
  }
}
```
In this example, we've used one keyword and shrunk the response to 1 position in SERP. Of course, you will get 99-100 positions in the real world, depending on special elements.


### More methods to up your awareness.

#### Get your task history.

Method [`getList`](/docs/serpstat-public-api/2jkkku527phy7-get-list) allows getting a list of required tasks with status for the last 7 days.
After 7 days all completted task will be purged.

#### Get raw SERP.

The [`getKeywordSerp`](/docs/serpstat-public-api/bfwx6sfgzlioz-get-keyword-serp) method returns the raw SERP in HTML format.
To get results you must use `keyword_id` parameter from  method `getTaskResult` response instead of keyword in string representation.

#### Control your balance.

The [`getParsingBalance`](/docs/serpstat-public-api/hx1b8q97pwu9y-get-parsing-balance) method return your balance and current price for one SERP parsing for the keyword.
```json
{
  "id": "123",
  "result": {
    "available_usd": "99999.891", <-- your balance
    "serp_parsing_cost": "0.0004",  <-- your price for one SERP
    "volume_parsing_cost": "0.0006"

  }
}
```

> Please note: [price is always negotiable](https://data.serpstat.com/serp-api-scraper/)! :)

docs.title: Keyword Not Contains Broad Match Filter
docs.summary:
Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). Excludes keywords with broad matches. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - excludes phras...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_not_contain_broad_match","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"13e03ccba40e1"},"$defs":{"keyword_not_contain_broad_match":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains Broad Match Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). Excludes keywords with broad matches. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - excludes phrases accounting for any word form. For example, excluding "backlink" will also exclude "backlinks", "backlinking", etc.

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_broad_match` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order (including word forms).
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimizing visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimized ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_broad_match` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **both** words are present (including word forms), regardless of order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimized seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimizing ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"214cd4077a481"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_not_contain_broad_match_schema"}}}}

docs.data:
{"id":"1qytvszw913u7","iid":"post-#SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getDistributionSDR","method":"post","path":"/#SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getDistributionSDR","summary":"getDistributionSDR","description":"The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getDistributionSDR` method returns an array containing objects with SDR value ranges and the number of domains that are included in these ranges. The data set is similar to the graph SDR distribution in the [Overview report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/dashboard/).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per request.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

docs.title: Serpstat Keyword Volume Checker API
docs.summary:
Use the Keyword Volume Checker API for bulk search volume analysis. Create asynchronous tasks to get accurate search volume data for very large lists of keywords.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which a...
docs.data:
{"id":"1uyfsa142buo9","name":"Serpstat Keyword Volume Checker API","description":"Use the Keyword Volume Checker API for bulk search volume analysis. Create asynchronous tasks to get accurate search volume data for very large lists of keywords.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### Credits and pricing

- This API has separate billing and credits type for this API are not included in any available subscription plan. [Contacts sales](https://data.serpstat.com/api-keyword-volume-checker/) for details.
- The cost varies from $0.001 to $0.0005 depending on the volume of credits required
- The minimum budget for the service is $300 
- Unlimited number of requests per day and month.
- Credits for SERP Crawling don't expire at the end of the month, you can use them when it is convenient for you.
- All keywords accepted to task are billed after task submission.
- Charged credits are not refundable.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

docs.title: Keyword Contains One Of Filter
docs.summary:
Keywords must contain AT LEAST ONE of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords that include any term from the array will be returned. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phras...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_contain_one_of","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"2a09563e847b7"},"$defs":{"keyword_contain_one_of":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains One Of Filter","description":"Keywords must contain AT LEAST ONE of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords that include any term from the array will be returned. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phrases containing at least one of the specified terms in their exact form (but not "backlinks" or "ranking" when searching for "backlink" or "rank").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **at least one** word is present, regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"371c51352bb3f"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_one_of_schema"}}}}

This filter allows you to target keywords based on user search behavior and intent classification.

**Available values:**
- `informational` - The user is looking for information or answers to a question. Example: *how does bitcoin work*, *symptoms of flu*. These queries aim to learn something, not to buy or act.
- `navigational` - The user wants to go to a specific website or brand. Example: *facebook login*, *netflix homepage*. The goal is to reach a particular site, not to discover new options.
- `commercial` - The user is researching products or services before making a purchase. Example: *best budget smartphones*, *iPhone 14 vs Samsung S22*. They intend to buy, but are still comparing and gathering opinions.
- `transactional` - The user is ready to complete an action, often a purchase. Example: *buy nike air max*, *order pizza online*. This is the "I'm ready to act now" intent — usually monetizable.","items":{"type":"string","enum":["informational","navigational","commercial","transactional"],"x-stoplight":{"id":"af239380aa26e"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"intents_contain_filter"}},"b407324519c01":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/intents_not_contain_filter","x-stoplight":{"id":"b407324519c01"}},"intents_not_contain_filter":{"type":"array","title":"intents not contain filter","description":"Exclude keywords that contain any of the specified search intents. This filter helps you remove unwanted intent categories from your keyword results.

**Available values:**
- `informational` - The user is looking for information or answers to a question. Example: *how does bitcoin work*, *symptoms of flu*. These queries aim to learn something, not to buy or act.
- `navigational` - The user wants to go to a specific website or brand. Example: *facebook login*, *netflix homepage*. The goal is to reach a particular site, not to discover new options.
- `commercial` - The user is researching products or services before making a purchase. Example: *best budget smartphones*, *iPhone 14 vs Samsung S22*. They intend to buy, but are still comparing and gathering opinions.
- `transactional` - The user is ready to complete an action, often a purchase. Example: *buy nike air max*, *order pizza online*. This is the "I'm ready to act now" intent — usually monetizable.","items":{"type":"string","enum":["informational","navigational","commercial","transactional"],"x-stoplight":{"id":"109dec8dbf537"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"intents_not_contain_filter"}},"eae4a414841e3":{"id":"eae4a414841e3","code":"200","description":"OK","headers":[],"contents":[{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/8116036dc72f2"}]},"8116036dc72f2":{"id":"8116036dc72f2","encodings":[],"mediaType":"application/json","examples":[{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/0ff31760e1304"}],"schema":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/a2fc49a777ff0"}},"0ff31760e1304":{"id":"0ff31760e1304","key":"Example In order to activate user you need to specify the user's ID (`user_id`). User's ID can be found using `TeamManagement.getList` method.

This method duplicates Team management functionality in the [user interface](https://serpstat.com/users/management/).

> Only unregistered users or registered users who are on the Free plan and didn't have paid plan earlier can be invited to the team.

> The team management API is available only to team managers and for plans of mid-tier and above.

The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getAnchors` method gives you a list of keywords used as anchors for backlinks of a site you analyze. The data set is similar to the [Anchors](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/anchors/) report.

docs.title: getIntersect
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getIntersect` method gives you a list of backlinks from intersecting donors to the analyzed domain. The data set is similar to the [Links intersect report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/intersect/).

Use case:

docs.title: SERP Features And Snippets Reference
docs.summary: A reference for the different types of SERP Features that Serpstat tracks in search results. Learn how to identify rich snippets, local packs, and more in your API reports.
docs.data:
---
stoplight-id: 3vs2ueyhe5j08
---

# SERP Features And Snippets Reference

A reference for the different types of SERP Features that Serpstat tracks in search results. Learn how to identify rich snippets, local packs, and more in your API reports.

## AI-Related SERP Features

| Type	| Description |
|----|---|
| `ai_overview` | AI-generated overview block at the top of search results|
| `snip_url_in_aio`| Url of this position was found in AI overview block|
| `snip_fqdn_in_aio`| FQDN (fully qualified domain name) of this position was found in AI overview block|

## All SERP Features

| Type	| Description |
|----|---|
| `a_box_c_converter` | Currency conversion calculator|
| `a_box_card` | Card with information about tournaments|
| `a_box_color_picker` | Color picker (color palette)|
| `a_box_dictionary` | Fragment of the dictionary (transcript, transcription of the request, interpretation)|
| `a_box_dtime` | Shows local date and time|
| `a_box_earthquake` | Information about earthquakes in the area|
| `a_box_flights` | Flight information table|
| `a_box_fsnippet` | Large information snippet|
| `a_box_g_converter` | General unit converter|
| `a_box_map` | Map with routes and addresses|
| `a_box_nutrition` | Nutrient values for foods|
| `a_box_population` | Population dynamics graph|
| `a_box_some` | Dates, addresses, etc.|
| `a_box_sports` | Information about sporting events (who? when? where?)|
| `a_box_stock` | Chart with stock quotes|
| `a_box_translation` | Block for translation|
| `a_box_weather` | Weather forecast|
| `a_box_when_is` | Reply to a request for an event date|
| `ads_bot` | Contextual advertising block at the bottom|
| `ads_rhs` | Contextual advertising block to the right of search results|
| `ads_top` | PPC block on top of search results|
| `also_asks` | List of questions related to the request|
| `bests` | Links to reviews, top rated products / services|
| `calc` | Online calculator|
| `car_loan_calc` | Car loan calculator|
| `discover_places` | Popular destinations|
| `graph` | Schedule for request|
| `kn_graph_brand` | Information about the desired organization|
| `kn_graph_card` | Information card|
| `kn_graph_carousel_list` | Carousel block — one row of dice, each transition to a different search page|
| `kn_graph_carousel_table` | Carousel block — several rows of dice with a transition|
| `kn_graph_disambiguation` | Other search options, on the right under the knowledge graph|
| `kn_graph_health` | Block with a description of the disease|
| `kn_graph_hotel_booking` | Hotel room reservation is part of the knowledge graph|
| `kn_graph_local` | Knowledge graph with map|
| `local_pack` | Block with a card and 3 addresses|
| `map` | Map|
| `mortgage_calc` | Mortgage calculator|
| `pic` | Examples of pictures for request|
| `refine_by_brand` | List of products by brand to request|
| `related_search` | Related phrases, tips|
| `research` | A selection of articles on request, located among the snippets|
| `shopping_rhs` | Shopping block on the right|
| `shopping_top` | Shopping block on top of the top|
| `shopping_bottom` | Shopping block at the bottom of the top|
| `snip_breadcrumbs` | Breadcrumbs instead of URL|
| `snip_doc_type` | Document format next to title snippet|
| `snip_https` | https in URL|
| `snip_image_thumbnail` | Image in snippet|
| `snip_info` | Additional information — contacts, dates, events, founders, chemical composition ...|
| `snip_reviews_stars` | Article rating with stars|
| `snip_search_box` | Search string inside snippet|
| `snip_sitelinks` | Additional links inside the snippet to other sections of the site|
| `snip_twitter` | Twitter posts section|
| `snip_video_thumbnail` | Icon for video inside snippet|
| `snip_amp_logo` | Icon on the right after breadcrumbs|
| `snip_best_answer` | Framed text in a carousel snippet|
| `top_stories` | List of news articles|
| `a_box_knowledge_game` | In the SERP under the translator there is a block with a question and answer buttons|
| `recipes` | Block with recipes at the top|
| `app_store` | Block in the middle of the issue with applications in the App Store|
| `podcasts` | Podcast block in the middle

The data set is similar to the Rank tracker - SERP history.

docs.title: Keyword Contains Filter
docs.summary:
Keywords must contain ALL specified terms (exact word matching). Only keywords that include every term from the array will be returned. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_contain","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"481925fab63a1"},"$defs":{"keyword_contain":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains Filter","description":"Keywords must contain ALL specified terms (exact word matching). Only keywords that include every term from the array will be returned. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phrases where the specified terms appear in their exact form (but not "backlinks" when searching for "backlink").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **both** words are present, regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimize seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"083bc3d4f36bb"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_schema"}}}}

docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_not_contain_one_of","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"4bf5553aa5e36"},"$defs":{"keyword_not_contain_one_of":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains One Of Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords containing any term from the array will be excluded. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - excludes phrases containing at least one of the specified terms in their exact form (but not "backlinks" or "ranking" when excluding "backlink" or "rank").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_one_of` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_one_of` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **at least one** word is present, regardless of order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"50e2ef5f88cbc"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_not_contain_one_of_schema"}}}}

docs.title: getUrlKeywords
docs.summary: The `SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlKeywords` method returns a list of keywords for which the specified URL ranks in the top-100 Google and top-50 Bing search results. It provides insights into the organic search performance of a page and is ideal for...
docs.data:
{"id":"58bzxr2rb7qwc","iid":"post-#SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlKeywords","method":"post","path":"/#SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlKeywords","summary":"getUrlKeywords","description":"The `SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlKeywords` method returns a list of keywords for which the specified URL ranks in the top-100 Google and top-50 Bing search results. It provides insights into the organic search performance of a page and is ideal for keyword research, content optimization, and competitor analysis. The data set is similar to the URL analysis — SEO research — [Keywords report](https://serpstat.com/urls/search/?query=&se=g_us&search_type=url&filter:0:0:block_condition=and&filter:0:0:field=right_spelling&filter:0:0:condition=not_contain&filter:0:0:value=).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: the number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request (items in `data` section of respone ).

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.


> You can get no more than 60 000 results per a query. For more data - use the export option in the UI of Domain Analysis, Keyword Analysis, or URL Analysis sections, or contact the manager for a personal upload of the results. 


Use Case:
1. *Analyze a Competitor* - Identify a relevant competitor's page.
2. *Extract Keywords* - Use `SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlKeywords` to extract keywords.
3. *Filter for Quality* - Apply filters to select the best keywords.
4. *Expand Your List* - Incorporate these keywords into your existing list.","extensions":{"x-stoplight":{"id":"58bzxr2rb7qwc"}},"tags":[],"securityDeclarationType":"inheritedFromService","request":{"body":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/8d7b1026f5d9f"}},"responses":[{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/39a137f47fc44"}],"security":[{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/2a2b517ca177d"}],"servers":[{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/2a91a016c2b64"}],"callbacks":[],"__bundled__":{"8d7b1026f5d9f":{"id":"8d7b1026f5d9f","contents":[{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/3a0415fd38d75"}]},"3a0415fd38d75":{"id":"3a0415fd38d75","encodings":[],"mediaType":"application/json","examples":[{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/31da9b6b568bc"}],"schema":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/b633c433d863d"}},"31da9b6b568bc":{"id":"31da9b6b568bc","key":"Example 1","value":{"id":"123","method":"SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlKeywords","params":{"se":"g_us","url":"https://www.nike.com/men","withIntents":true,"sort":{"position":"asc"},"filters":{"cost_from":1,"cost_to":1000,"intents_contain":["commercial"],"intents_not_contain":["navigational"]},"page":1,"size":2}},"name":"Example 1"},"b633c433d863d":{"type":"object","properties":{"id":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/jigaw6rjynizz","x-stoplight":{"id":"5fe150abc5544"}},"method":{"type":"string","description":"Should be exact `SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlKeywords`","x-stoplight":{"id":"566dba8670cb0"}},"params":{"type":"object","properties":{"se":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/tzbv1pqgpp6qr","x-stoplight":{"id":"2f2bf4c2226a2"}},"url":{"type":"string","description":"Analyzed page URL","format":"uri","examples":["https://www.nike.com"],"x-stoplight":{"id":"3ae0e7a2a67e4"}},"withIntents":{"type":"boolean","description":"Keyword intent

Only keywords that include every term from the array will be returned. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phrases where the specified terms appear in their exact form (but not "backlinks" when searching for "backlink").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **both** words are present, regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimize seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"083bc3d4f36bb"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_schema"}},"e754ad3d17891":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/keyword_not_contain_schema","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"e754ad3d17891"}},"keyword_not_contain_schema":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords containing any term from the array will be excluded. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - excludes phrases where the specified terms appear in their exact form (but not "backlinks" when excluding "backlink").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **both** words are present, regardless of order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimize seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"0b29f33aab9fa"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_not_contain_schema"}},"2a09563e847b7":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/keyword_contain_one_of_schema","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"2a09563e847b7"}},"keyword_contain_one_of_schema":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains One Of Filter","description":"Keywords must contain AT LEAST ONE of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords that include any term from the array will be returned. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phrases containing at least one of the specified terms in their exact form (but not "backlinks" or "ranking" when searching for "backlink" or "rank").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **at least one** word is present, regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"371c51352bb3f"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_one_of_schema"}},"f0e463da8a22c":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/keyword_not_contain_one_of_schema","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"f0e463da8a22c"}},"keyword_not_contain_one_of_schema":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains One Of Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords containing any term from the array will be excluded. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - excludes phrases containing at least one of the specified terms in their exact form (but not "backlinks" or "ranking" when excluding "backlink" or "rank").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_one_of` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_one_of` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **at least one** word is present, regardless of order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"50e2ef5f88cbc"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_not_contain_one_of_schema"}},"a81f41459472e":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/keyword_contain_broad_match_schema","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"a81f41459472e"}},"keyword_contain_broad_match_schema":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains Broad Match Filter","description":"Keywords must contain ALL specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). docs.title: getUrlMissingKeywords
docs.summary: The `SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlMissingKeywords` method returns keywords that competitors are ranking for but the given URL isn’t ranking for them. The data set is similar to [Missing keywords report](https://serpstat.com/urls/missing-keywords/?qu...
docs.data:
{"id":"6d8wt6v89v2ap","iid":"post-#SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlMissingKeywords","method":"post","path":"/#SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlMissingKeywords","summary":"getUrlMissingKeywords","description":"The `SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlMissingKeywords` method returns keywords that competitors are ranking for but the given URL isn’t ranking for them. The data set is similar to [Missing keywords report](https://serpstat.com/urls/missing-keywords/?query=&se=g_us&search_type=url&filter:0:0:block_condition=and&filter:0:0:field=right_spelling&filter:0:0:condition=not_contain&filter:0:0:value=) in the URL analysis.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: the number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request (items in `data` section of respone ).

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

> You can get no more than 60 000 results per a query. For more data - use the export option in theUI of Domain Analysis, Keyword Analysis, or URL Analysis sections, or contact the manager for a personal upload of the results. 


Use case: 
1. Use `SerpstatUrlProcedure.getUrlMissingKeywords`, set the URL of the page to analyze its missing keywords.
2. Get a response with a list of missing keywords.
3. docs.title: getCompetitors
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getCompetitors` method lists the domains that rank for the given keyword in Google top-20 results.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**:  **1 credit per row in response.** The number of charged credits corresponds t...
docs.data:
{"id":"6vpejje0stt4k","iid":"post-#SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getCompetitors","method":"post","path":"/#SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getCompetitors","summary":"getCompetitors","description":"The `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getCompetitors` method lists the domains that rank for the given keyword in Google top-20 results.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**:  **1 credit per row in response.** The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request.

{"id":"702sxckcniz9h","iid":"post-#SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummary","method":"post","path":"/#SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummary","summary":"getSummary","description":"The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummary` method gives you general information about link profile: number of external links, referring IP addresses and subnets, number of referring domains and subdomains, domain authority indicator and types of referring links. The data set is similar to the [Overview report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/dashboard/).

<!-- theme: danger -->
> **This method is deprecated*

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 5 API credits are spent per 1 request

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.




Use case:
1. You want to understand what links your competitors have.
2. Use `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummary` to get information about the number of inbound links and referring domains;
3. Determine which sites are linking to your competitors to identify potential link opportunities for your client.","deprecated":true,"extensions":{"x-stoplight":{"id":"702sxckcniz9h"}},"tags":[],"securityDeclarationType":"inheritedFromService","request":{"body":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/f2b3ffc5104e9"}},"responses":[{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/a90bea1524a14"}],"security":[{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/a1e644f72670d"}],"servers":[{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/6af39fbce322d"}],"callbacks":[],"__bundled__":{"f2b3ffc5104e9":{"id":"f2b3ffc5104e9","contents":[{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/11016fe413cdb"}]},"11016fe413cdb":{"id":"11016fe413cdb","encodings":[],"mediaType":"application/json","examples":[{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/66e0fcffb5f76"}],"schema":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/ed038ebe1398d"}},"66e0fcffb5f76":{"id":"66e0fcffb5f76","key":"Example 1","value":{"id":"123","method":"SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummary","params":{"query":"serpstat.com","searchType":"domain"}},"name":"Example 1"},"ed038ebe1398d":{"type":"object","properties":{"id":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/sy25nw3cvqkof","x-stoplight":{"id":"54b08bdeba0c0"}},"method":{"type":"string","description":"Should be exact `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummary`","x-stoplight":{"id":"7cfb1bbde659d"}},"params":{"type":"object","properties":{"query":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/pi1aut98nv527","x-stoplight":{"id":"87c966e3b9b75"}},"searchType":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/9ebt2h8uh55e4","x-stoplight":{"id":"108a05b4ab040"}}},"required":["query"],"x-stoplight":{"id":"a165ac1783789"}}},"required":["id","method"],"x-examples":{"Example 1":{"id":"123","method":"SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummary","params":{"query":"serpstat.com","searchType":"domain"}}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"ed038ebe1398d"}},"sy25nw3cvqkof":{"type":"string","title":"id","description":"Request / response identifier, prodvided from your side, will be mirrored from request to `id` in response. docs.title: Errors and Response Codes
docs.summary: This page lists all possible status codes and errors returned by Serpstat Public API.Use this reference when debugging requests or handling API responses.
docs.data:
---
stoplight-id: 704g22jqj5lqb
---

# Errors and Response Codes

This page lists all possible status codes and errors returned by Serpstat Public API.  
Use this reference when debugging requests or handling API responses.

---

## 400 – Bad Request

- `Query required`: The query parameter (domain, URL) was not specified.
- `SE database parameter not set`: Add `{required_se}` to your query. The SE parameter was not specified.
- `Wrong search engine`: Invalid search engine.
- `Missing token`: Query token is missing.
- `Json schema validation error`: Not a valid JSON query schema.

---

## 402 – Payment Required / Plan Limitations

- `Plan credit exceeded`: Your pricing plan has run out of credits.
- `Pricing plan credits exceeded`: Credits exhausted for the current billing period.
- `To get more than {max_sort_size}`: Use export report methods. Maximum allowable credit for sorting exceeded.

---

## 403 – Forbidden

- `Problems with authorization`: Invalid token, forbidden method or user blocked.
- `Selected SE is limited`: Search engine is not available for your account.
- `Forbidden query`: Query access denied.
- `Invalid token`: Invalid query token.
- `Invalid user`: Not a valid user.
- `Not enough credits`: Not enough credits for this query.
- `API not allowed for your plan`: This method is unavailable for your plan.
- `Method forbidden`: Access to the procedure is prohibited.
- `Not access to functional`: Invalid request method or access denied for this procedure.

---

## 404 – Not Found

- `Empty result`: No results returned.
- `Wrong API query`: Use API domain subdomain; Invalid API query.

---

## 429 – Too Many Requests

- `Query frequency exceeded`: Increase the interval between queries.
- `Too many queries`: You’ve exceeded the query limit.

---

## 500 – Internal Server Error

- `Undefined server error`: Something went wrong on our side.
 
---

## 32xxx – Custom Application-Level Errors

- `32012 – Credits exceeded`: Credits are over.
- `32018 – Wrong search engine provided`: Invalid search engine specified.
- `32016 – Large query domains not supported`: Large domains are not available for query.
- `32116 – Procedure name not allowed exact count`: Used when getting the exact number of available rows.
- `32116 – Method not supported by provider`: This method or query is not supported by the selected provider.

---

## 32015 / 32017 – No Data Found

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

- `32015 – No data found for requested domain`: No info found for the specified domain.
- `32017 – No data found for requested domain`: No info found for the specified domain or the error message text can simply be "Data not found".

---

## 32117 – Filtering and Parameter Errors

- `Not allowed field: {field}`: The field for the filter is incorrect or not supported.
- `Invalid crawl date`: The date in the filter is incorrect.
- `Not allowed method {method} for field {field}`: Filtering method not supported.
- `Not allowed values for between method`: Invalid values in `between`.
- `Field compareType is required`: `compareType` filtering method not specified.
- `Field value is required`: Filter field is not set.
- `Not allowed params for filter`: Invalid filter parameters.

### Match Type

docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_contain_broad_match","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"7d4bdba550d81"},"$defs":{"keyword_contain_broad_match":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains Broad Match Filter","description":"Keywords must contain ALL specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). More flexible matching compared to exact matching. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - finds phrases accounting for any word form. For example, searching for "backlink" will also match "backlinks", "backlinking", etc.

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain_broad_match` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order (including word forms).
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimizing visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimized ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain_broad_match` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **both** words are present (including word forms), regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimized seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimizing ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"d08ededc1e499"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_broad_match_schema"}}}}

docs.title: Custom Data Export by Serpstat
docs.summary: Transform Serpstat's vast SEO database into actionable insights tailored specifically for your business needs.
docs.data:
# Custom Data Export by Serpstat

Transform Serpstat's vast SEO database into actionable insights tailored specifically for your business needs.

## What We Offer

Get direct access to our comprehensive SEO data through customized exports designed around your requirements. Whether you need competitive analysis, market trends, or keyword opportunities – we'll deliver the exact data you need, in the format that works best for your workflow.

## Why Choose Custom Export?

• **Flexible Data Format**: Choose from industry-standard formats including CSV, Parquet, or direct BigQuery integration – perfectly aligned with your existing data infrastructure

• **Scale Without Limits**: Access data in any volume – from focused datasets to comprehensive market analysis

• **Custom-Tailored Structure**: Get data structured exactly how you need it, optimized for your specific use case and analysis tools

## Perfect For:

- Enterprise SEO teams requiring deep market analysis
- Data scientists integrating SEO insights into existing models
- Marketing agencies handling multiple high-volume projects
- Business intelligence teams seeking raw SEO data for custom analysis

## How It Works:

1. Tell us your data requirements and preferred format
2. Receive a custom quote based on your needs
3. Get your data delivered in your chosen format

Contact our [enterprise team](https://data.serpstat.com/#contact-us) to discuss your custom data export needs and get a quote tailored to your requirements.

docs.summary:
Automate your technical site audits with the Audit API. Retrieve data on errors, get category statistics, and access scan history to integrate into your monitoring systems.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, throu...
docs.data:
{"id":"7sojfhgut3kcl","name":"Audit API","description":"Automate your technical site audits with the Audit API. Retrieve data on errors, get category statistics, and access scan history to integrate into your monitoring systems.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits (limits)

When calculating the used credits, your pricing plan's API requests are taken into account, including identical requests and requests for export.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phrases where the specified terms appear in their exact form (but not "backlinks" when searching for "backlink").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **both** words are present, regardless of order.

docs.title: intents contain filter
docs.summary:
Include keywords that contain one or several of the specified search intents. This filter allows you to target keywords based on user search behavior and intent classification.

**Available values:**
- `informational` - The user is looking for inf...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/intents_contain","x-stoplight":{"id":"8ba9943e3a87a"},"$defs":{"intents_contain":{"type":"array","title":"intents contain filter","description":"Include keywords that contain one or several of the specified search intents. This filter allows you to target keywords based on user search behavior and intent classification.

**Available values:**
- `informational` - The user is looking for information or answers to a question. Example: *how does bitcoin work*, *symptoms of flu*. These queries aim to learn something, not to buy or act.
- `navigational` - The user wants to go to a specific website or brand. Example: *facebook login*, *netflix homepage*. The goal is to reach a particular site, not to discover new options.
- `commercial` - The user is researching products or services before making a purchase. Example: *best budget smartphones*, *iPhone 14 vs Samsung S22*. They intend to buy, but are still comparing and gathering opinions.
- `transactional` - The user is ready to complete an action, often a purchase. Example: *buy nike air max*, *order pizza online*. This is the "I'm ready to act now" intent — usually monetizable.","items":{"type":"string","enum":["informational","navigational","commercial","transactional"],"x-stoplight":{"id":"af239380aa26e"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"intents_contain_filter"}}}}

docs.title: Keyword Analysis API
docs.summary:
Research keywords at scale with the Keyword Analysis API. Access data on search volume, keyword difficulty, competitors, and discover related queries to improve your keyword strategy.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint...
docs.data:
{"id":"8qvah42r5f9la","name":"Keyword Analysis API","description":"Research keywords at scale with the Keyword Analysis API. Access data on search volume, keyword difficulty, competitors, and discover related queries to improve your keyword strategy.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits (limits)

When calculating the used credits, your pricing plan's API requests are taken into account, including identical requests and requests for export.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

docs.title: Keyword Not Contains One Of Broad Match Filter
docs.summary:
Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - excludes phrases containing any of the specified wor...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"98fb5e66d92cb"},"$defs":{"keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains One Of Broad Match Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - excludes phrases containing any of the specified words or their word forms. For example, excluding "backlink" or "rank" will also exclude "backlinks", "ranking", "ranked", etc.

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order (including word forms).
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimizing visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimized ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **at least one** word is present (including word forms), regardless of order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo optimized tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimizing ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"211dcc46b70df"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match_schema"}}}}

docs.title: Keyword Contains Broad Match Filter
docs.summary:
Keywords must contain ALL specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). More flexible matching compared to exact matching. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - finds phrases a...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_contain_broad_match","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"a81f41459472e"},"$defs":{"keyword_contain_broad_match":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains Broad Match Filter","description":"Keywords must contain ALL specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). More flexible matching compared to exact matching. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - finds phrases accounting for any word form. For example, searching for "backlink" will also match "backlinks", "backlinking", etc.

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain_broad_match` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order (including word forms).
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimizing visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimized ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain_broad_match` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **both** words are present (including word forms), regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimized seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimizing ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"d08ededc1e499"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_broad_match_schema"}}}}

docs.title: Keyword Not Contains One Of Broad Match Filter
docs.summary:
Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - excludes phrases containing any of the specified wor...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"a8eae9275cdba"},"$defs":{"keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains One Of Broad Match Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - excludes phrases containing any of the specified words or their word forms. For example, excluding "backlink" or "rank" will also exclude "backlinks", "ranking", "ranked", etc.

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order (including word forms).
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimizing visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimized ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **at least one** word is present (including word forms), regardless of order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo optimized tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimizing ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"211dcc46b70df"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match_schema"}}}}

docs.title: deactivateUser

The `TeamManagement.deactivateUser` method deactivates active user in your team. In order to deactivate user you need to specify the user's ID. 

User's ID can be found using `TeamManagement.getList` method.

After deactivation user would lose acc...

In order to deactivate user you need to specify the user's ID. 

User's ID can be found using `TeamManagement.getList` method.

> Please note: To free a seat in your team you have to delete user from your team via `TeamManagement.removeUser` method after deactivating.

docs.title: intents not contain filter
docs.summary:
Exclude keywords that contain any of the specified search intents. This filter helps you remove unwanted intent categories from your keyword results.

**Available values:**
- `informational` - The user is looking for information or answers to a qu...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/intents_not_contain","x-stoplight":{"id":"b407324519c01"},"$defs":{"intents_not_contain":{"type":"array","title":"intents not contain filter","description":"Exclude keywords that contain any of the specified search intents. This filter helps you remove unwanted intent categories from your keyword results.

**Available values:**
- `informational` - The user is looking for information or answers to a question. Example: *how does bitcoin work*, *symptoms of flu*. These queries aim to learn something, not to buy or act.
- `navigational` - The user wants to go to a specific website or brand. Example: *facebook login*, *netflix homepage*. The goal is to reach a particular site, not to discover new options.
- `commercial` - The user is researching products or services before making a purchase. Example: *best budget smartphones*, *iPhone 14 vs Samsung S22*. They intend to buy, but are still comparing and gathering opinions.
- `transactional` - The user is ready to complete an action, often a purchase. Example: *buy nike air max*, *order pizza online*. This is the "I'm ready to act now" intent — usually monetizable.","items":{"type":"string","enum":["informational","navigational","commercial","transactional"],"x-stoplight":{"id":"109dec8dbf537"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"intents_not_contain_filter"}}}}

docs.title: Search engine short names
docs.summary: A complete list of short names for all search engines supported by Serpstat. Use these official identifiers in your API requests to specify the correct search database for analysis. This parameter se is widelly used in most Search Analytics methods.
docs.data:
---
stoplight-id: ba97ni814ao9p
---

# Search engine short names

A complete list of short names for all search engines supported by Serpstat. Use these official identifiers in your API requests to specify the correct search database for analysis. This parameter `se` is widelly used in most Search Analytics methods.


Example `"se":"g_us"` 

## For Google

docs.title: getAdKeywords
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getAdKeywords` method searches for keywords in paid search results and advertising listings for a specific domain.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per member of `data` object array in response.

> The number of charged cred...

docs.title: Keyword Not Contains Broad Match Filter
docs.summary:
Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). Excludes keywords with broad matches. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - excludes phras...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_not_contain_broad_match","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"c3275320fada4"},"$defs":{"keyword_not_contain_broad_match":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains Broad Match Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). Excludes keywords with broad matches. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - excludes phrases accounting for any word form. For example, excluding "backlink" will also exclude "backlinks", "backlinking", etc.

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_broad_match` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order (including word forms).
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimizing visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimized ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_broad_match` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **both** words are present (including word forms), regardless of order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimized seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimizing ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"214cd4077a481"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_not_contain_broad_match_schema"}}}}

docs.title: Keyword Contains One Of Broad Match Filter
docs.summary:
Keywords must contain AT LEAST ONE of the specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - finds phrases containing any of the specified word...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"c7d5fadc63b36"},"$defs":{"keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains One Of Broad Match Filter","description":"Keywords must contain AT LEAST ONE of the specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - finds phrases containing any of the specified words or their word forms. For example, searching for "backlink" or "rank" will also match "backlinks", "ranking", "ranked", etc.

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order (including word forms).
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimizing visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimized ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **at least one** word is present (including word forms), regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo optimized tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimizing ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"225b85156bf50"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match_schema"}}}}

docs.title: intents contain filter
docs.summary:
Include keywords that contain one or several of the specified search intents. This filter allows you to target keywords based on user search behavior and intent classification.

**Available values:**
- `informational` - The user is looking for inf...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/intents_contain","x-stoplight":{"id":"dabbd042d9254"},"$defs":{"intents_contain":{"type":"array","title":"intents contain filter","description":"Include keywords that contain one or several of the specified search intents. This filter allows you to target keywords based on user search behavior and intent classification.

**Available values:**
- `informational` - The user is looking for information or answers to a question. Example: *how does bitcoin work*, *symptoms of flu*. These queries aim to learn something, not to buy or act.
- `navigational` - The user wants to go to a specific website or brand. Example: *facebook login*, *netflix homepage*. The goal is to reach a particular site, not to discover new options.
- `commercial` - The user is researching products or services before making a purchase. Example: *best budget smartphones*, *iPhone 14 vs Samsung S22*. They intend to buy, but are still comparing and gathering opinions.
- `transactional` - The user is ready to complete an action, often a purchase. Example: *buy nike air max*, *order pizza online*. This is the "I'm ready to act now" intent — usually monetizable.","items":{"type":"string","enum":["informational","navigational","commercial","transactional"],"x-stoplight":{"id":"af239380aa26e"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"intents_contain_filter"}}}}
