{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_contain","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"e0929db339e49"},"$defs":{"keyword_contain":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains Filter","description":"Keywords must contain ALL specified terms (exact word matching). Only keywords that include every term from the array will be returned. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phrases where the specified terms appear in their exact form (but not "backlinks" when searching for "backlink").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **both** words are present, regardless of order.

docs.title: Keyword Not Contains Filter
docs.summary:
Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords containing any term from the array will be excluded. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - excludes phrase...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_not_contain","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"e754ad3d17891"},"$defs":{"keyword_not_contain":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords containing any term from the array will be excluded. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - excludes phrases where the specified terms appear in their exact form (but not "backlinks" when excluding "backlink").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **both** words are present, regardless of order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimize seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"0b29f33aab9fa"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_not_contain_schema"}}}}

docs.title: Team Management API
docs.summary:
Manage your Serpstat team members via the API. Easily add, activate, deactivate, or remove users to simplify account and access management.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be p...
docs.data:
{"id":"eulycl3dnfrz8","name":"Team Management API","description":"Manage your Serpstat team members via the API. Easily add, activate, deactivate, or remove users to simplify account and access management.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits (limits)

When calculating the used credits, your pricing plan's API requests are taken into account, including identical requests and requests for export.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

docs.title: Keyword Not Contains One Of Filter
docs.summary:
Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords containing any term from the array will be excluded. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - excludes phrase...
docs.data:
{"$ref":"#/%24defs/keyword_not_contain_one_of","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"f0e463da8a22c"},"$defs":{"keyword_not_contain_one_of":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains One Of Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords containing any term from the array will be excluded. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - excludes phrases containing at least one of the specified terms in their exact form (but not "backlinks" or "ranking" when excluding "backlink" or "rank").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_one_of` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_one_of` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **at least one** word is present, regardless of order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"50e2ef5f88cbc"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_not_contain_one_of_schema"}}}}

{"id":"fan1bd16rencj","name":"Serpstat Project Management API v4","description":"Manage your Serpstat projects with the Project Management API v4. This section covers methods to create and delete your projects and get projects list via API.


### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Main concept

This API allows you to manage Projects. 

Project is a long term entity, in simple words, your domain that you do  SEO actions for. 

To start Site audit or start tracking positions in SERPs you shoud create a new project with domain's name.



### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits (limits)

When calculating the used credits, your pricing plan's API requests are taken into account, including identical requests and requests for export.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

{"id":"fbbvt84sg54bg","name":"Rank Tracker API","description":"Track your website's search engine rankings with the Rank Tracker API. Access historical position data, monitor competitors, and analyze visibility dynamics for your projects.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits (limits)

When calculating the used credits, your pricing plan's API requests are taken into account, including identical requests and requests for export.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

> **AI Overview**: Google AI Overview results are currently available within standard **Desktop** SERP Crawling requ...

{"id":"fd78zl20ap9w1","iid":"post-#tasks.addTask","method":"post","path":"/#tasks.addTask","summary":"addTask","description":"The `tasks.addTask` method allows sending keywords to crawl regular SERP and local results and get a task ID for further queries.

> **AI Overview**: Google AI Overview results are currently available within standard **Desktop** SERP Crawling requests at no additional cost. This allows you to access AI-generated summaries and reference sources as part of your regular SERP data. However, **starting August 1, 2025, AI Overview data will become a separate optional parameter** type=`regular_aio` **with additional pricing**. After this date, you will need to specifically enable AI Overview in your API requests and account for the additional costs in your usage billing.

> **NOTE**: This API has separate billing, and credits for this API are not included in any available subscription plan and must be purchased separately. docs.title: searchTypeUrl

Search modes for analysis

* **domain** - only domain (`site.com`)
* **domain_with_subdomains** - domain with subdomains (`subdomain.site.com`)
* **url** - the specific URL (`site.com/path/`)
* **part_url** - URL starts with (`site.com/path/*`)

docs.title: intents contain filter
docs.summary:
Include keywords that contain one or several of the specified search intents. This filter allows you to target keywords based on user search behavior and intent classification.

**Available values:**
- `informational` - The user is looking for inf...
docs.data:
{"type":"array","title":"intents contain filter","description":"Include keywords that contain one or several of the specified search intents. This filter allows you to target keywords based on user search behavior and intent classification.

**Available values:**
- `informational` - The user is looking for information or answers to a question. Example: *how does bitcoin work*, *symptoms of flu*. These queries aim to learn something, not to buy or act.
- `navigational` - The user wants to go to a specific website or brand. Example: *facebook login*, *netflix homepage*. The goal is to reach a particular site, not to discover new options.
- `commercial` - The user is researching products or services before making a purchase. Example: *best budget smartphones*, *iPhone 14 vs Samsung S22*. They intend to buy, but are still comparing and gathering opinions.
- `transactional` - The user is ready to complete an action, often a purchase. Example: *buy nike air max*, *order pizza online*. This is the "I'm ready to act now" intent — usually monetizable.","items":{"type":"string","enum":["informational","navigational","commercial","transactional"],"x-stoplight":{"id":"af239380aa26e"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"intents_contain_filter"}}

**Available values:**
- `informational` - The user is looking for information or answers to a qu...

{"type":"array","title":"intents not contain filter","description":"Exclude keywords that contain any of the specified search intents. This filter helps you remove unwanted intent categories from your keyword results.

- `navigational` - The user wants to go to a specific website or brand. Example: *facebook login*, *netflix homepage*. The goal is to reach a particular site, not to discover new options.
- `commercial` - The user is researching products or services before making a purchase. Example: *best budget smartphones*, *iPhone 14 vs Samsung S22*. They intend to buy, but are still comparing and gathering opinions.
- `transactional` - The user is ready to complete an action, often a purchase. Example: *buy nike air max*, *order pizza online*. This is the "I'm ready to act now" intent — usually monetizable.","items":{"type":"string","enum":["informational","navigational","commercial","transactional"],"x-stoplight":{"id":"109dec8dbf537"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"intents_not_contain_filter"}}

docs.title: getAdKeywords
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getAdKeywords` returns paid keywords and ads copies that pop up for the queried keyword in paid search results.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**:  **1 credit per row in response.** 
> The number of charged credi...

<!-- theme: success -->

docs.title: getDomainKeywords
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getDomainKeywords` method return keywords which the analyzed domain ranks for in Google top-100 search results. The data set is similar to the Domain analysis — SEO research — Keywords report. 
You can get up to 60 000...
docs.data:
{"id":"j5jbjt0rk7oei","iid":"post-#SerpstatDomainProcedure.getDomainKeywords","method":"post","path":"/#SerpstatDomainProcedure.getDomainKeywords","summary":"getDomainKeywords","description":"The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getDomainKeywords` method return keywords which the analyzed domain ranks for in Google top-100 search results. The data set is similar to the Domain analysis — SEO research — Keywords report. 
You can get up to 60 000 results in this report.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per member of `data` object array in response. 

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

## New Feature: SERP Special Elements Filtering

This method now supports filtering by SERP special elements using `types_contain` and `types_not_contain` filters. These filters allow you to:

- **Include keywords** that rank in search results containing specific SERP features (like local pack, featured snippets, etc.)
- **Exclude keywords** that rank in search results with unwanted SERP features (like ads, shopping results, etc.)

For the complete list of available special elements, refer to the [SERP Features Reference](../docs/spec-elements.md).

The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request. 


With the Serpstat API, you can only get the first 60,000 results, regardless of the number and size of the queries themselves. For more data - use the export option in the Domain Analysis, Keyword Analysis, or URL Analysis sections, or contact the manager for a personal upload of the results.

","x-stoplight":{"id":"k9ni1x1s3gxtk"}},"keyword_contain_schema":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains Filter","description":"Keywords must contain ALL specified terms (exact word matching). Only keywords that include every term from the array will be returned. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phrases where the specified terms appear in their exact form (but not "backlinks" when searching for "backlink").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **both** words are present, regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimize seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"083bc3d4f36bb"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_schema"}},"keyword_not_contain_schema":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords containing any term from the array will be excluded. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - excludes phrases where the specified terms appear in their exact form (but not "backlinks" when excluding "backlink").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **both** words are present, regardless of order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimize seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"0b29f33aab9fa"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_not_contain_schema"}},"keyword_contain_one_of_schema":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains One Of Filter","description":"Keywords must contain AT LEAST ONE of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords that include any term from the array will be returned. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phrases containing at least one of the specified terms in their exact form (but not "backlinks" or "ranking" when searching for "backlink" or "rank").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **at least one** word is present, regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"371c51352bb3f"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_one_of_schema"}},"keyword_not_contain_one_of_schema":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains One Of Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords containing any term from the array will be excluded. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - excludes phrases containing at least one of the specified terms in their exact form (but not "backlinks" or "ranking" when excluding "backlink" or "rank").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_one_of` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_one_of` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **at least one** word is present, regardless of order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"50e2ef5f88cbc"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_not_contain_one_of_schema"}},"keyword_contain_broad_match_schema":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains Broad Match Filter","description":"Keywords must contain ALL specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). More flexible matching compared to exact matching. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - finds phrases accounting for any word form. For example, searching for "backlink" will also match "backlinks", "backlinking", etc.

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain_broad_match` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order (including word forms).
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimizing visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimized ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain_broad_match` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **both** words are present (including word forms), regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimized seo tips for bloggers"

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - excludes phrases accounting for any word form. For example, excluding "backlink" will also exclude "backlinks", "backlinking", etc.

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_broad_match` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order (including word forms).
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimizing visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimized ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_broad_match` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **both** words are present (including word forms), regardless of order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimized seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimizing ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"214cd4077a481"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_not_contain_broad_match_schema"}},"keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match_schema":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains One Of Broad Match Filter","description":"Keywords must contain AT LEAST ONE of the specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). docs.title: Introduction to Serpstat API
docs.summary: Welcome to the Serpstat API documentation. Find all you need to integrate our powerful SEO data into your applications, automate reporting, and build custom tools for your workflow. API (application program interface) allows you to retrieve large ...
docs.data:
---
stoplight-id: jenasqbwtxdlr
---

# Introduction to Serpstat API

Welcome to the Serpstat API documentation. Find all you need to integrate our powerful SEO data into your applications, automate reporting, and build custom tools for your workflow. API (application program interface) allows you to retrieve large amounts of data without using the Serpstat user interface.
Our API consists of these thematic chapters:

- **Domain Analysis**: Various data about domain SEO stats.
- **Keyword Analysis**: Keyword selection, synonyms, suggestions.
- **Url Analysis**: SEO stats for specific URLs or paths of the website
- **Backlink Analysis**: Backlinks, External Links, Referring domains and Domain stats
- **Domain Classification**:  Classify your domain listings by the most common categories used by Google.
- **Site Audi**t: Scan your website for common SEO errors.
- **Rank Tracker**:  Track the ranks of your website's keywords.
- **Project Management**: Manage your projects.
- **Team Management**: Manage your team directly.
- **SERP Crawling**: Crawl SERPs through API with AI overview scrapping. 
- **Keyword Volume Checker**: Set up the keyword volume scanning through API.
- **Credits API**: Stats about your API credits usage.

 
### Getting ready:

#### 1. Activate Subscription

- To use Serpstat API make sure you have an active subscription.
- Serpstat API is available on middle and top tier subscripion plans. Checkout [our plans here](https://serpstat.com/page/pricing-plans/).
- Especially for heavy API usage we offer special API plans.

- You can try out API at trial period with no payment needed.

#### 2. Get API Token
- You need a personal API token to start using Serpstat API. 
- Token can be generated (or renewed) at your [Serpstat profile section](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/).

#### 3. Testing

Each user can have only one API token per user.

There are no sandbox, test endpoint or any other test environment. 

For testing, we suggest you:

1. Add a test user account to your team
2. Give them a small amount of API credits
3. Use their token as test credentials

This helps avoid accidentally spending your main API credits during testing. 


### Our API standard

We using JSON-RPC 2.0


### Custom methods, volumes?

Looking for custom options, like dealing with big volumes or reselling data? Need help with developing solutions to cover your tasks? Book a [call with our experts](https://data.serpstat.com/#contact-us) to get professional assistance.

docs.title: Domain Classification API
docs.summary:
Use the Domain Classification API to determine the thematic category or niche of any domain. This categorization comes from evaluating the domain’s primary subject matter.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, throug...
docs.data:
{"id":"jj5nrsbjeb9wi","name":"Domain Classification API","description":"Use the Domain Classification API to determine the thematic category or niche of any domain. This categorization comes from evaluating the domain’s primary subject matter.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits (limits)

When calculating the used credits, your pricing plan's API requests are taken into account, including identical requests and requests for export.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

docs.title: Keyword Contains Broad Match Filter
docs.summary:
Keywords must contain ALL specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). More flexible matching compared to exact matching. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

docs.data:
{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains Broad Match Filter","description":"Keywords must contain ALL specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). More flexible matching compared to exact matching. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - finds phrases accounting for any word form. For example, searching for "backlink" will also match "backlinks", "backlinking", etc.

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain_broad_match` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order (including word forms).
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimizing visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimized ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain_broad_match` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **both** words are present (including word forms), regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimized seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimizing ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"d08ededc1e499"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_broad_match_schema"}}

docs.data:
{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains One Of Broad Match Filter","description":"Keywords must contain AT LEAST ONE of the specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - finds phrases containing any of the specified words or their word forms. For example, searching for "backlink" or "rank" will also match "backlinks", "ranking", "ranked", etc.

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order (including word forms).
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimizing visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimized ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **at least one** word is present (including word forms), regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo optimized tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimizing ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"225b85156bf50"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match_schema"}}

docs.data:
{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Contains One Of Filter","description":"Keywords must contain AT LEAST ONE of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords that include any term from the array will be returned. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phrases containing at least one of the specified terms in their exact form (but not "backlinks" or "ranking" when searching for "backlink" or "rank").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **at least one** word is present, regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"371c51352bb3f"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_one_of_schema"}}

docs.data:
{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (exact word matching). Keywords containing any term from the array will be excluded. You can specify 1 to 100 exclusion terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - excludes phrases where the specified terms appear in their exact form (but not "backlinks" when excluding "backlink").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **both** words are present, regardless of order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimize seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"0b29f33aab9fa"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_not_contain_schema"}}

docs.title: getCompetitors
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getCompetitors` method brings in the list of domain competitors in top 20 Google search results. 
The data set is similar to the [Competitors report](https://serpstat.com/domains/competitors/?query=&se=g_us&search_type...

> Credits: 1 credit per one `result` array member in `data` object in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

docs.title: getLostOutlinks
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getLostOutlinks` method gives you a list of lost external links of a site you analyze. The data set is similar to the [Lost external links report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/lost-outlinks/). 

<!-- theme: succes...

The data set is similar to the [Lost external links report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/lost-outlinks/). 

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case: 
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getLostOutlinks` method, check what links your site has lost to find out why they were lost and try to establish these links     * 1 - windows

    * 4 - OS X
    * 5 - IOS
    * 6 - any OS
    * 7 - all OS
    * 8 - chrome OS

* **threat_type** - a type of vulnerability, possible values:
    * 1 - malware
    * 2 - social engineering
    * 3 - unwanted software
    * 4 - potentially harmful application
* **lastupdate** - link detection date. Value format: `YYYY-MM-DD` (2001-01-01)","x-stoplight":{"id":"a0995833a8e71"}},"compareType":{"type":"string","enum":["gt","lt","gte","lte","eq","neq","between","contains","notContains","startsWith","endsWith"],"description":"Comparisoin type

* **eq** - exact match (number or text value)
* **neq** - does not meet the requirement (number or text value)
* **between** - between (two number values, from .. and to ..)

docs.title: getLostBacklinks
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getLostBacklinks` method gives you a list of lost backlinks of a site you analyze. The data set is similar to the [Lost backlinks report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/lost-links/).

docs.summary: The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getThreats` method returns a list of malicious domains referring to the analyzed domain and information on them. The data set is similar to the [Malicious sites report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/malicious-domai...

{"id":"newx5e1tjjt0y","iid":"post-#SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getThreats","method":"post","path":"/#SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getThreats","summary":"getThreats","description":"The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getThreats` method returns a list of malicious domains referring to the analyzed domain and information on them. <!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case:
1. docs.title: Serpstat Url Analysis API
docs.summary:
Analyze any specific URL with the URL Analysis API. Get data on a page's traffic, ranking keywords, competitors, and find missing keyword opportunities for optimization.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through ...
docs.data:
{"id":"oc2emgo18vdim","name":"Serpstat Url Analysis API","description":"Analyze any specific URL with the URL Analysis API. Get data on a page's traffic, ranking keywords, competitors, and find missing keyword opportunities for optimization.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits (limits)

When calculating the used credits, your pricing plan's API requests are taken into account, including identical requests and requests for export.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

docs.title: Domain Analysis API
docs.summary:
Conduct in-depth analysis of any website with the Domain Analysis API. Get data on organic visibility, traffic, keywords, competitors, and much more.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests s...
docs.data:
{"id":"okpb7grp4v67f","name":"Domain Analysis API","description":"Conduct in-depth analysis of any website with the Domain Analysis API. Get data on organic visibility, traffic, keywords, competitors, and much more.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.
 
### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits (limits)

When calculating the used credits, your pricing plan's API requests are taken into account, including identical requests and requests for export.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

docs.title: export
docs.summary:
Export a complete site audit report in a convenient format. Use this method to download technical SEO data for offline analysis or client reporting.
> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

docs.title: getDomainsIntersection
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getDomainsIntersection` method returns common keywords of up to 3 domains. 
The data set is similar to the Domain vs domain report.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per one `result` array member in `dat...

docs.title: getAllRegionsTraffic
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getAllRegionsTraffic` method returns an array with information about the amount of traffic by domain in Serpstat databases. Databases with a number of keywords equal to zero are not shown in the response.

<!-- theme: ...
docs.data:
{"id":"qa2ih3uak03yo","iid":"post-#SerpstatDomainProcedure.getAllRegionsTraffic","method":"post","path":"/#SerpstatDomainProcedure.getAllRegionsTraffic","summary":"getAllRegionsTraffic","description":"The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getAllRegionsTraffic` method returns an array with information about the amount of traffic by domain in Serpstat databases. Databases with a number of keywords equal to zero are not shown in the response.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per one `result` array member in `data` object in response.

docs.title: Audit errors
docs.summary: A reference guide to all error codes and descriptions that can be found during a site audit. Use this list to interpret results and prioritize fixes based on data from the Audit API.
docs.data:
---
stoplight-id: qq7lrv3zfvhd9
---

# Audit errors

A reference guide to all error codes and descriptions that can be found during a site audit. Use this list to interpret results and prioritize fixes based on data from the Audit API.

| category          | error name                            | error description                                   |
| ----------------- | ------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| pages_status      | errors_400                            | Server status code: 4xx                             |
|                   | errors_500                            | Server status code: 5xx                             |
| meta_tags         | no_desc                               | Missing Description tag                             |
|                   | no_title                              | Missing Title tag                                   |
|                   | tiny_desc                             | Description Too Short                               |
|                   | long_title                            | Title is too long                                   |
|                   | tiny_title                            | Title is too short                                  |
|                   | many_title                            | Multiple title tags                                 |
|                   | meta_refresh                          | Used meta refresh tag for redirect                  |
|                   | title_dup_h1                          | h1 duplicates title                                 |
|                   | charset_missing                       | Missing character encoding                          |
|                   | long_desc                             | Description Too Long                                |
|                   | pages_title_dup                       | Title duplicated                                    |
|                   | pages_desc_dup                        | Duplicate Description                               |
|                   | pages_h1_dup                          | Duplicate h1                                        |
| headings          | h1_missing                            | Missing h1 Heading                                  |
|                   | many_h1                               | Multiple h1 headings                                |
| content           | large_page_size                       | Too large page size                                 |
|                   | body_text_missing                     | Missing body text                                   |
|                   | dummy_text                            | Lorem Ipsum placeholder text                        |
| multimedia        | broken_image_url                      | Broken Images                                       |
|                   | large_image_size                      | Image size is too large                             |
|                   | image_no_alt                          | Image contains empty alt attribute                  |
| indexation        | many_canonical                        | Multiple rel="canonical" tags                       |
|                   | use_flash                             | Flash elements on page                              |
|                   | use_iframe                            | iframe found on page                                |
|                   | less_words                            | Low word count                                      |
|                   | wrong_canonical                       | Page with canonical tag                             |
|                   | hidden_no_index                       | Page is blocked from crawling with noindex tag      |
|                   | hidden_robots_txt                     | Page is blocked from crawling in robots.txt file    |
|                   | offsite_canonical                     | Cross-domain canonical links                        |
|                   | relative_canonical                    | Canonical has a relative URL                        |
| redirects         | redirects                             | Corrupt Redirects                                   |
| links             | many_get_params                       | Too many URL parameters                             |
|                   | long_url                              | URL Too Long                                        |
|                   | many_external_links                   | Too many on-page links                              |
|                   | miss_favicon                          | Missing Favicon                                     |
|                   | external_link_without_no_follow_exist | External links do not contain rel="nofollow"        |
|                   | internal_links_no_follow_exist        | Internal links contain rel="nofollow" attribute     |
| https             | https_check_domain_in_cert            | Incorrect certificate name                          |
|                   | https_hsts                            | HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) not supported |
|                   | https_cert_chain                      | SSL certificate chain violated                      |
|                   | https_expired                         | Certificate is invalid                              |
|                   | https_tls                             | Old version of the TLS protocol                     |
|                   | https_sslv3                           | Using SSL protocol                                  |
|                   | https_self_signed                     | Self-signed certificate                             |
|                   | https_sitemap_with_http               | HTTP URLs are present in sitemap.xml                |
|                   | https_mixed_content                   | HTTPS/HTTP mixed content                            |
|                   | https_link_to_http                    | HTTPS page leads to HTTP page                       |

| markup            | markup_schema_missing                 | Missing schema markup                               |

|                   | markup_twitter_card_missing           | Missing Twitter Cards markup                        |
| pagespeed_desktop | OptimizeImages                        | Optimize images for desktop                         |
|                   | LeverageBrowserCaching                | Use of browser caching                              |
| pagespeed_mobile  | MinimizeRenderBlockingResources       | Above the fold content for mobile                   |
|                   | LeverageBrowserCaching                | Use of browser caching                              |
| server_params     | https_status:no_redirect              | Page is available via HTTP and does not redirect to HTTPS |
|                   | www_status:www_status                 | WWW version and non-WWW version do not redirect to each other |

docs.title: getOrganicCompetitorsPage
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getOrganicCompetitorsPage` method brings in the list of domain competitors in top 20 Google search results. The data set is similar to the Competitors report of the domain.

docs.title: getAdsCompetitors
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getAdsCompetitors` method brings in the list of domain competitors in PPC.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**:  **1 credit per row in response.** 
> The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of result...

docs.title: SERP Special Elements Contains Filter
docs.summary:
Filter keywords that contain ANY of the specified SERP special elements. Keywords ranking in search results that include at least one of the specified SERP features will be returned. You can specify 1 to 50 special elements.

### What are Special ...
docs.data:
{"type":"array","title":"SERP Special Elements Contains Filter","description":"Filter keywords that contain ANY of the specified SERP special elements. Keywords ranking in search results that include at least one of the specified SERP features will be returned. You can specify 1 to 50 special elements.

### What are Special Elements?

Special elements are different types of SERP features that appear in search results. For the complete list of available special elements, refer to the [SERP Features Reference](../docs/spec-elements.md).

### Usage Examples

The following examples demonstrate how to use this filter:

**Example:** Returns only keywords where the domain ranks in results that include local pack.
```json
{
  "types_contain": ["local_pack"]
}
```

**Example:** Returns keywords where the domain ranks in results that include "People also ask" questions **OR** related search suggestions **(or both)**.
```json
{
  "types_contain": ["also_asks", "related_search"]
}
```","examples":[["local_pack","also_asks"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"92642b54f3c51"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"types_contain_schema"}}

docs.title: SERP Special Elements Not Contains Filter
docs.summary:
Filter keywords that do NOT contain ANY of the specified SERP special elements. Keywords ranking in search results that include any of the specified SERP features will be excluded. You can specify 1 to 50 special elements.

### What are Special El...
docs.data:
{"type":"array","title":"SERP Special Elements Not Contains Filter","description":"Filter keywords that do NOT contain ANY of the specified SERP special elements. Keywords ranking in search results that include any of the specified SERP features will be excluded. You can specify 1 to 50 special elements.

### What are Special Elements?

Special elements are different types of SERP features that appear in search results. For the complete list of available special elements, refer to the [SERP Features Reference](../docs/spec-elements.md).

### Usage Examples

The following examples demonstrate how to use this filter:

**Example:** Excludes keywords where the domain ranks in results that include PPC ads at the top.
```json
{
  "types_not_contain": ["ads_top"]
}
```

**Example:** Excludes keywords where the domain ranks in results that include shopping results at the top **OR** PPC ads at the top **(or both)**.
```json
{
  "types_not_contain": ["shopping_top", "ads_top"]
}
```","examples":[["ads_top","shopping_top"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"89ae0978fd296"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"types_not_contain_schema"}}

docs.data:
---
stoplight-id: u6fdz4prsbezn

{"id":"uhy05n77e38uy","iid":"post-#SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getRefDomains","method":"post","path":"/#SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getRefDomains","summary":"getRefDomains","description":"The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getRefDomains` method gives you a list of referring domains of a site you analyze. The data set is similar to the [Referring domains report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/refdomains/). The data in this report and the Summary report may differ slightly due to the algorithm for quickly calculating summary data.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case:
1.  <!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1000 API credits for each parameter in `output_data`. One parameter (`traffic` or `keywords`) costs 1000 credits. Two parameters (`traffic` and `keywords`) cost 2000 credits.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

docs.title: getHistoryByCountError
docs.summary:
This method displays the number of changed errors and information messages for each issue category across all reports within a project. It enables tracking of issue resolution progress over time.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

docs.title: getKeywords
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getKeywords` shows organic keywords associated with the researched keyword that domains are ranking for in Google's top-100 results and for every found keyword you'll see its volume, CPC and level of competition.

Only keywords that include every term from the array will be returned. You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phrases where the specified terms appear in their exact form (but not "backlinks" when searching for "backlink").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **both** words are present, regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "optimize seo tips for bloggers"
  * "best tactics to optimize ranking seo"","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"083bc3d4f36bb"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_schema"}},"db269eb0be745":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/keyword_not_contain_schema","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"db269eb0be745"}},"keyword_not_contain_schema":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (exact word matching). ### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - excludes phrases where the specified terms appear in their exact form (but not "backlinks" when excluding "backlink").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples of excluded phrases**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_not_contain` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will exclude lines where **both** words are present, regardless of order.

  * "optimize seo tips for bloggers"

### Match Type

This filter uses **exact match** - finds phrases containing at least one of the specified terms in their exact form (but not "backlinks" or "ranking" when searching for "backlink" or "rank").

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimize visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimize ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **at least one** word is present, regardless of order.

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

  * "how to seo optimized ranking"

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_not_contain_broad_match` with `["seo optimize"]` will exclude only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order (including word forms).

You can specify 1 to 100 search terms.

### Match Type

This filter uses **broad match** - finds phrases containing any of the specified words or their word forms. For example, searching for "backlink" or "rank" will also match "backlinks", "ranking", "ranked", etc.

### Filtering Rules

#### Word Order

*When the words are in a single string (space-separated), order matters.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match` with `["seo optimize"]` will return only lines where the words appear **exactly** in that order (including word forms).
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly"
  * "seo optimizing visibility for ecommerce"
  * "how to seo optimized ranking"

*When the words are passed as separate elements, order does **not** matter.*

Using `keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match` with `["seo", "optimize"]` will return lines where **at least one** word is present (including word forms), regardless of order.
  **Examples**

  * "seo optimize traffic quickly" (contains both)
  * "seo optimized tips for bloggers" (contains seo)
  * "best tactics to optimizing ranking" (contains optimize)","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"items":{"type":"string","minLength":1,"x-stoplight":{"id":"225b85156bf50"}},"x-stoplight":{"id":"keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match_schema"}},"a8eae9275cdba":{"$ref":"#/__bundled__/keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match_schema","examples":[["seo","optimize"]],"x-stoplight":{"id":"a8eae9275cdba"}},"keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match_schema":{"type":"array","title":"Keyword Not Contains One Of Broad Match Filter","description":"Keywords must NOT contain ANY of the specified terms (broad matching including morphological forms). docs.title: getNewBacklinks
docs.summary:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getNewBacklinks` method gives you a list of active backlinks of a site you analyze. The data set is similar to the [Backlinks report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/active-links/).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credi...

The data set is similar to the [Backlinks report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/active-links/).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case:
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getNewBacklinks` method, check active links leading to a competitor's domain and their domain rank to find out what domains are more preferrable to place links to docs.title: Languages
docs.summary: A list of all supported languages and their unique codes for SERP Scraper. This reference is essential for correctly configuring the language parameters in your requests.
docs.data:
---
stoplight-id: wuoshjguna09o
---

# Languages

A list of all supported languages and their unique codes for SERP Scraper. This reference is essential for correctly configuring the language parameters in your requests. 

| Id | name (in English) | code 
|----| ----| ----
|1| English| en
|2| Arabic| ar

|18| Chinese (Simplified)| zh-CN

Use the `RtApiProjectProcedure.getProjects` method to get a list of your projects.
The method will save you time on getting information on your project ID, name, date of creation without the need of entering the platform.

docs.title: Backlinks API
docs.summary:
Analyze the backlink profile of any domain with our Backlinks API. Get comprehensive data on referring domains, anchors, new and lost links, DR, and other key link-building metrics.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint U...
docs.data:
{"id":"xu9jnzib39dsn","name":"Backlinks API","description":"Analyze the backlink profile of any domain with our Backlinks API. Get comprehensive data on referring domains, anchors, new and lost links, DR, and other key link-building metrics.

### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits (limits)

When calculating the used credits, your pricing plan's API requests are taken into account, including identical requests and requests for export.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

docs.data:
{"id":"ylg7q8n96yjci","iid":"post-#SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummaryV2","method":"post","path":"/#SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummaryV2","summary":"getSummaryV2","description":"The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummaryV2` method gives you general information about link profile: number of external links, referring IP addresses and subnets, number of referring domains and subdomains, domain authority indicator and types of referring links. 

The data set is similar to the [Overview report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/dashboard/) at Serpstat UI.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 5 API credits are spent per 1 request. 
<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

*The data in this report and all the detailed reports can differ slightly due to the algorithm for quickly calculating summary data.*

Use case: 
1. You want to understand what links your competitors have.
2. Use `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummaryV2` to get information about the number of inbound links and referring domains;
3. Determine which sites are linking to your competitors to identify potential link opportunities for your client
